meta.name: description
meta.content: The 412 Precondition Failed HTTP status code indicates the server could not perform a requested action because of a conditional request failure.

main.p: The 412 Precondition Failed HTTP status code indicates a conditional request failed and the requested action could not be performed. This typically indicates the resource changed since the previous request to this resource, and the client should re-request the representation and try again.

aside.p: Nit: This status code could include an option to return the current, changed version of the resource, so that the client doesn't need to make a new request. This could perhaps be implemented with return=representation.

main.p: If the request contains an If-Unmodified-Since or If-Match headers, parse each header header and return 412 Precondition Failed if the condition fails. The response payload may be a document describing the reasons for failure, the new state of the resource, and/or changes to the resource since the client's copy.
If the client is attempting to perform a safe request and the server merely needs to indicate there's no changes, without indicating an error, see 304 Not Modified instead.
A 412 Precondition Failed indicates the resource changed from. The client needs to update the representation available, and try again.
See If-Unmodified-Since and If-Match for guidence on making these requests.

dd.a: RFC 7232: HTTP/1.1 Conditional Requests §4.2. 412 Precondition Failed
